title: >>> V8
body_text:
LXXXVI Rematch at CX1!
Cornero, Adams meet again
A match of this magnitude certainly needs no fancy introduction. Hands down, two of the absolute best the game has to offer, each competing to answer the simple question:
"Who is the best?"
2005
mogul, the legendary
Kevin Adams
;
2007
rookie-of-the-year candidate
Grant Cornero
...
The knowledge, the killer instinct unleashed in Game 1 - Adams scored first. One would think "Alright, nothing to worry about! Only the first round! We'll get 'em next game!"
Yeah right.
Those brief opening minutes transformed into hours of torture for Team CORNERO. The 2005 phenom had locked in another four victories just to kick things off. It had become apparent whose night this belonged too right from the getgo.
And just when things were looking bright for the 18 year-old rookie captain, the wily veteran turned the contest right around, blasting bulletballs left and right, remorselessly knocking-down warriors without hesitation.
Flash Results by Game
: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10 (Adams); 6, 7, 11, 12 (Cornero)
One has to hand it to the gutsy Cornero, laying it all on the line in this intense return match. But experience prevailed, giving Adams his record-setting 8th career win. The final score: 8 to 4.
Moments and Stars
: Diana DiBuccio's hilarious "Nazi March" elimination on Melissa Kerr; Chris Adams's Game 12 catches in a matter of seconds; the free-for-all Game 13
RECORDS
> Attendance: 29
> Notable Returns: Meredith Lewis (last competed at DB 92); Steve Adams (last competed at DB 100); Lenny Herrera (last competed at DB 105)
> New Players: (1) Steve Pham
- DODGEBALL CX1 kicked off the 12th Season, taking place on the back courts of Wall High School for the 23rd consecutive time.
- This was the record-breaking 20th straight event without any wet weather. To date, DODGEBALL 91:
CREAMation 2
in early-June was the last
Wet War
.
- Kevin Adams stamped his name in the history books as the most winning captain ever, capturing his 8th career victory. He defeated Grant Cornero 8 to 4 in their DODGEBALL LXXXVI rematch, both of which Cornero has lost. This was Kevin's 10th captains run as well, tying that record with his brother Chris Adams and John Tronolone.
- Competitors of DODGEBALL CX1 were treated to Luke's pizza. Luke's generosity is truly appreciated having delivered the delicious pies for one full year.
________________________________________
_______________________
"UNDEFEATED v. DEFEATED"
MIKE EDWARDS v. DEREK CARTY
The light, agile, quick-witted sensation
Mike Edwards
attempts to capture his fourth crown, this time taking on perhaps the most unlucky team general in the game's history, the 0 and 5
Derek Carty
. It's either the continuation of one man's dominance or the biggest upset ever witnessed.
Catch this unique, never-before-seen encounter at DODGEBALL CX2 on November 17.
And don't forget to check back later in the week for not only the power preview, but a look at November 2005 and 2006; arguably the most crucial time periods in the game's history, and for very different reasons!

LXXXVI Rematch at CX1!
Cornero, Adams meet again

A match of this magnitude certainly needs no fancy introduction. Hands down, two of the absolute best the game has to offer, each competing to answer the simple question: "Who is the best?"

2005 mogul, the legendary Kevin Adams; 2007 rookie-of-the-year candidate Grant Cornero ...

The knowledge, the killer instinct unleashed in Game 1 - Adams scored first. One would think "Alright, nothing to worry about! Only the first round! We'll get 'em next game!"

Yeah right.

Those brief opening minutes transformed into hours of torture for Team CORNERO. The 2005 phenom had locked in another four victories just to kick things off. It had become apparent whose night this belonged too right from the getgo.

And just when things were looking bright for the 18 year-old rookie captain, the wily veteran turned the contest right around, blasting bulletballs left and right, remorselessly knocking-down warriors without hesitation.

Flash Results by Game: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10 (Adams); 6, 7, 11, 12 (Cornero)

One has to hand it to the gutsy Cornero, laying it all on the line in this intense return match. But experience prevailed, giving Adams his record-setting 8th career win. The final score: 8 to 4.

Moments and Stars: Diana DiBuccio's hilarious "Nazi March" elimination on Melissa Kerr; Chris Adams's Game 12 catches in a matter of seconds; the free-for-all Game 13

RECORDS
> Attendance: 29
> Notable Returns: Meredith Lewis (last competed at DB 92); Steve Adams (last competed at DB 100); Lenny Herrera (last competed at DB 105)
> New Players: (1) Steve Pham

- DODGEBALL CX1 kicked off the 12th Season, taking place on the back courts of Wall High School for the 23rd consecutive time.
- This was the record-breaking 20th straight event without any wet weather. To date, DODGEBALL 91: CREAMation 2 in early-June was the last Wet War.
- Kevin Adams stamped his name in the history books as the most winning captain ever, capturing his 8th career victory. He defeated Grant Cornero 8 to 4 in their DODGEBALL LXXXVI rematch, both of which Cornero has lost. This was Kevin's 10th captains run as well, tying that record with his brother Chris Adams and John Tronolone.
- Competitors of DODGEBALL CX1 were treated to Luke's pizza. Luke's generosity is truly appreciated having delivered the delicious pies for one full year.

_______________________________________________________________


"UNDEFEATED v. DEFEATED"
MIKE EDWARDS v. DEREK CARTY

The light, agile, quick-witted sensation Mike Edwards attempts to capture his fourth crown, this time taking on perhaps the most unlucky team general in the game's history, the 0 and 5 Derek Carty. It's either the continuation of one man's dominance or the biggest upset ever witnessed.

Catch this unique, never-before-seen encounter at DODGEBALL CX2 on November 17.

And don't forget to check back later in the week for not only the power preview, but a look at November 2005 and 2006; arguably the most crucial time periods in the game's history, and for very different reasons!
